name: Casona de la Reyna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in Toledo and chose this hotel after reading many reviews on TripAdvisor. This hotel was quite memorable for many reasons. We stayed in room #1 (up two or three stairs and across from the front desk.) It was huge! The master bedroom had a large bed, a small desk, TV, ample closet space, and a full bathroom. Attached was a small living area. In addition to a couch (which likely converted into a bed) and a chair, there was a desk and a chest that held another TV. The living area also had another large closet and a 3/4 bathroom. Needless to say, the room was quite comfortable. Although our room overlooked a small turnaround that was also a bus stop, the street was very quiet. Also, even though we were close to the front desk and small dining area, we never heard any noise. The breakfasts were quite good, with a variety of cereals, meats, cheeses, pastries, juices, and fruit. The staff was quite friendly and accomodating at all times. I also appreciated having access to a computer in the lobby area. There's limited free parking in front of the hotel. We weren't lucky enough to find a place out front, but were satisfied to put our rental car in the paid parking below the hotel. We had some difficulty finding the hotel, but a friendly local police officer helped us after we discovered we were driving in circles. The hotel is at the bottom of a fairly steep hill, which some may find daunting. However, there was also a railing alongside the buildings up the hill, which helped our ascent and descent. Because the bus stopped outside the front the hotel, I believe those who would have trouble navigating the hills could choose the bus as an easy alternative.
reviews.title: Memorable Room

likes.liked: — The size of the room and the atmosphere
likes.disliked: — The trek up the hill to the main part of the center city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to Toledo and were pleased to find this hotel in the old part of the city. It is easy to find and has free parking (which is amazing). Leave the car and walk the city as driving in Toledo is for locals in smart cars only! The good news is that you can easily walk anywhere in the old city from here.
reviews.title: Free Parking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a fabulous view and the rooms were comfortable, the staff friendly and everyone spoke good english. Our only complaint was the noise from a student group on tour, however we had our trusty earplugs with us and slept like babies.

reviews.text: Recently stayed 3 nights at this small, pretty, fairly new hotel. It is in a good location if you are arriving by car as it is in the southern end of the old historic town (Old Jewish quarter) accessed by a modern wide road and has its own secure garage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in cold Toledo November. We arrived by car and what is important the hotel is easily accesible which is not always the case in meadieval towns. Rooms are execellent - nicely decorated, clean and bathroom is delivered with a stylish touch and you appreciate the effort to turn this old house into modern buildings with all the infrastructure of a modern hotel. I sleep in a few hotels around Europe every year and I was impressed with how well we slept in this hotel. maybe it was great bed - big and confortable, maybe the silence (the hotel window was to the side street). Anyway an important address for those tired after all day sight seeing of this magnificient town.
reviews.title: Excellent accomodation at reasonable price

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights from 18th February. Clean well decorated room overlooking River Tajo. Parking on street just outside, although hotel has own car park. Buffet style breakfast of cold meats, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit and pastries was superb. Staff extremely friendly and courteous and gave excellent recommendation to visit Aranjuez and Chinchon, as we had time to spare before catching flight back to London. At GBP50 for room and breakfast per night, it represented excellent value. Location at southern end of city means there is an uphill climb into the centre through the narrow cobbled streets, although a bus stop is just outside the hotel on the opposite side of the road. We would recommend to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable no-nonsense type of hotel at a good price. Casona de la Reyna is part of a national hotel chain, which operates two other hotels in Toledo. Toledo itself is a charming historic city with plenty to see and do. If you like marzipan, you may never want to leave!!
reviews.title: Charming Little Gem in a historic City

description: The Sercotel Casona de la Reyna Hotelis a charming and welcoming hotel located in the Ronda de Toledo, next to the Castilla-La Mancha Parliament and very close to the historic city centre. It is less than a five minute walk from the Jewish Quarter, the convent of the Barefoot Franciscans of San Gil, the home of El Greco and the Toledo Cathedral.The Sercotel Casona de la Reyna Hotel, our hotel in downtown Toledo, you will find 25 comfortable rooms, all outward-facing and equipped with free WiFi internet, ideal for a romantic getaway to Toledo.
